alert.note: Alert for Methow Valley; Okanogan Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 16 at 2:50PM PDT until July 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DRY, WINDY CONDITIONS INTO MONDAY... .The passage of a dry cold front will break down the hot ridge of high pressure and bring critical fire conditions to much of central and eastern Washington through Monday. Hot southerly winds will be found this evening across central and north central Washington. Winds will shift to the west and northwest overnight. Expect strong westerly winds across central and eastern Washington on Monday in the wake of a dry cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE METHOW AND OKANOGAN VALLEYS... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 703 Okanogan Valley (Zone 703) and Fire Weather Zone 704 Methow Valley (Zone 704). * Winds: Southerly 12 to 18 mph with local gusts to 30 mph through early this evening. Winds shifting to west and northwest by late evening. On Monday, west-northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidities: 9 to 18 percent through this evening, 15 to 25 percent Monday. * Impacts: Be cautious of shifting winds to the west this evening. The hot, dry winds will lead to the potential for rapid spread of any new fires. Despite cooler temperatures and an increase in humidity Monday, strong wind are expected to blow through the day.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
